intro: Cremanthodium ellisii var. ramosum, commonly known as the Sierra gladiolus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and slopes. Its stems are usually branched, giving it a bushy appearance, and it produces showy, pink to purple flowers. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in areas with well-drained soil and full sun exposure.
